bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to William D. Postell, November 26, 1941

div1.p: Hench informs Postell that he has written to W. Branks Stewart requesting a photograph of the memorial bas-relief. He has also written to Agramonte's daughter, and thinks it would be wise for the Agramonte Memorial Library to see that she gets a photograph of the memorial.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to William D. Postell, November 26, 1941
div1.opener:
November 26, 1941
Mr. William D. Postell, Librarian
Agramonte Memorial Library
Medical Center
Louisiana State University
New Orleans, La.
My dear Mr. Postell:
div1.p:
I enclose a carbon of a letter to Mr. Stewart, written at
your suggestion. I have also written Miss Agramonte sending her a
list of the data you have (list made by me), telling her of your pride
in her father's data, of your unsuccessful search for the Mart note
and of your earnest desire to have more data when possible. I told
her of the beauty of the building, sent her some of your bookplates
and spoke of the memorial in the hall. I think it would be a smart
thing for your department to see to it that she gets a photo of the
memorial. It will certainly please her and make her more receptive
to any requests you may make regarding her father's data. I would
be glad indeed to have a copy if a photo of the memorial is taken and
will be glad to pay for it.

I enjoyed my visit with you very much and appreciated the
courtesies of yourself and your colleague. I also had a very nice visit
with Dr. Matas.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
